intro: Stylochaeton zenkeri, commonly known as the Zanzibar milkweed, is a flowering plant native to eastern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, fragrant flowers. Its leaves are opposite and often have a velvety texture. Stylochaeton zenkeri is adapted to tropical and subtropical climates, thriving in well-drained soils.
